node.title: WHO says Europe COVID-19 surge 'a grave concern' as hospitalisations double in a week
node.alt: People in masks line up to be vaccinated
node.description: The World Health Organization is warning 500,000 people could die in the next three months in Europe and central Asia, as COVID-19 surges across the region.
node.content:
["The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned\u00a0500,000 people could die of COVID-19 in\u00a0Europe and Central Asia in the next three months, as virus transmission rates surge\u00a0across the region.\u00a0", "WHO Europe director Hans Kluge said Europe was back at the \"epicentre\" of the pandemic, facing a resurgence of cases, hospitalisations and deaths.\u00a0", "Case numbers were beginning to near-record levels again\u00a0and the pace of transmission in the region was\u00a0of \"grave concern\", he\u00a0said.\u00a0", "\"Over the past four\u00a0weeks, Europe has seen a greater than 55 per cent\u00a0increase in new COVID-19 cases,\" Dr Kluge said.\u00a0", "\"There are now more reported cases \u2013 78 million \u2013 in the European region than in South-East Asia, the Eastern Mediterranean, the Western Pacific and Africa combined.\"", "The region includes European Union states, along with the United Kingdom, Russia, Turkey, Israel\u00a0and the former Soviet republics of\u00a0Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan\u00a0and Uzbekistan.\u00a0", "Hospitalisation rates for COVID-19 have more than doubled in the region over the past week.", "If that trajectory continues, Dr Kluge warned, Europe and Central Asia\u00a0could see another 500,000 pandemic deaths by February 2022.\u00a0", "", "
Several Central and Eastern European countries are reporting record numbers of COVID-19 cases and deaths.\u00a0(AP: Valentina Petrova)
", "
'Insufficient vaccination coverage' despite availability
", "The WHO this week reported COVID-19 case numbers had\u00a0risen in Europe for a fifth consecutive week, with increases observed\u00a0across \"all age groups\".\u00a0", "The infection rate is\u00a0now the highest in the world, at 192 new cases per 100,000 people.", "Insufficient vaccination coverage, and the relaxation of public health and social measures, Dr Kluge said, were to blame for the resurgence.\u00a0", "Dr Kluge said countries in the region were at \"varying stages of vaccination rollout\", and an\u00a0average of 47 per cent\u00a0of people had been fully vaccinated.", "Only eight countries had topped 70\u00a0per cent vaccination coverage, while in two countries the rate remained below 10 per cent.\u00a0", "\"Where vaccine uptake is low \u2013 in many countries in the Baltics, central and eastern Europe, and the Balkans \u2013 hospital admission rates are high,\" he said.", "\"It is imperative that authorities invest all efforts to accelerate the pace of vaccination roll-out.\"", "WHO emergency director Mike Ryan said some European countries had \"sub-optimal vaccination coverage\" despite availability.", "\"It's a warning shot for the world to see what is happening in Europe despite the availability of vaccination,\" Mr\u00a0Ryan told a news conference.", "Dr Kluge\u00a0stressed the vaccines were \"doing what they were intended to do\".\u00a0", "\"Most people hospitalised and dying from COVID-19 today are not fully vaccinated.\"", "Dr Kluge said countries\u00a0needed to consider reintroducing public health and social measures, saying 95 per cent universal mask usage could save up to 188,00 lives in coming months.\u00a0", "", "
Romania reported a record daily number of 591 COVID-19 deaths this week.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Andreea Alexandru)
", "
Record cases as nations chase vaccine\u00a0uptake\u00a0
", "The warning comes as several Central and Eastern European nations reported new daily coronavirus records.\u00a0", "Ukraine, Croatia, Slovenia and Slovakia reported their highest ever numbers of daily cases, while others registered the most infections in months.", "Most Central and Eastern European countries have vaccinated about half of their populations or less, which is lower than the European Union average of some 75 per cent.\u00a0", "Anti-virus restrictions have also varied as governments sought to boost vaccination rates rather than reimpose lockdowns and other strict measures that are widely unpopular and could hurt the economy.", "Romania reported a record daily number of 591 COVID-19 deaths this week, as it continues to battle a major outbreak that has overwhelmed its health system.\u00a0", "Bulgaria also reported its highest daily COVID-19 death toll this week, after 310 people died in 24 hours.\u00a0", "Only 28.5 per cent of Bulgaria's population of 7 million has been fully vaccinated.", "", "
\u00a0Many Croats have rushed to vaccination centres in Zagreb amid a COVID-19 surge.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Darko Bandic)
", "In Croatia, authorities reported a record daily high of 6,310 new cases and 32 deaths, with doctors warning\u00a0the pressure on hospitals was rising.", "Croatian officials said they would announce wider use of COVID vaccine passes but wouldn't introduce a lockdown.", "Alarmed by the surge, many Croats rushed to vaccination points in the capital Zagreb to get jabbed, or receive booster shots.", "In neighbouring Slovenia, the official STA news agency said hospitals were filling up fast, and a new record of 4,511 daily infections was reported on Thursday.", "Hospitals in the nation of 2 million already have scrapped non-urgent interventions to make space for COVID-19 patients.", "The country has introduced COVID-19 vaccine passes for the working population but the government said surging infections could force a lockdown.", "", "
Some COVID-19 patients have been airlifted from Romania to Germany for treatment, as Romania's healthcare system struggles to cope with the virus surge.(dpa via AP:\u00a0Gregor Fischer)
", "Serbia's government pandemic crisis team met on Thursday as medical experts urged a 10-day lockdown.", "Serbia's populist government has been reluctant to tighten pandemic regulations, focusing on getting more people vaccinated.", "In Serbia, as in Slovenia, vaccination rates are just over 50 per cent.\u00a0", "The Balkan nation of 7 million has reported more than 1 million cases and over 10,000 deaths so far.", "Some 6,100 new cases were recorded on Thursday, while 64 people died.", "Slovakia, a nation with one of the lowest COVID-19 inoculation rates in the European Union, announced new restrictions, after it reported a record 6,713 new infections.", "From Monday, hotels, bars, restaurants, and gyms across almost half the country's counties will be forced to close.", "ABC/Wires", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
"]
